Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; faded hook maeander pattern in added white between white bands; possible trace of faded white lotus below; top of rim glazed; exterior: band of blobs at rim above broken maeander pattern between pairs of lines; below, painted decoration consisting of face in outline to left, probably of a woman; inscription to her left.
Curator's comments: The sherd may belong to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.848. The number '32' is written on the exterior of the sherd in pencil.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 286, no. 831, pl. III)
Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166, no. 62, pl. 34, no. 14)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 720, no. 785)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1975) (phase 2)
